repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Financial Sector Technical
            Assistance Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Financial Sector
            Technical Assistance Loan Project (FSTAL) for Brazil were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            technical assistance loans are a good complement to
            Programmatic lending. The Brazilian government's strong
            commitment to financial sector reform and the Bank's
            extensive work in preparing the programmatic loans
            facilitated the design of the FSTAL and its focus on
            supporting institutional development needs of the principal
            financial sector regulatory agencies. High capacity
            countries like Brazil need Technical Assistance (TA) loans
            to support institutional strengthening, but the projects
            have to be focused on the needs of the beneficiary. In the
            case of Brazilian Central Bank (BCB), their interest was
            mostly in hardware and software to upgrade essential
            components of the payments system and in training programs
            for banking examiners. Brazilian Securities and Exchange
            Commission (CVM) needs were concentrated in the operational
            areas of enforcement, inspections, surveillance, and
            financial and accounting norms. TA projects should have a
            short duration with active Bank participation. The project
            timeline should define the scope of activities. Simpler,
            shorter and possibly more frequent projects may result in
            better outcomes over time. TA loans should be stressed as an
            important part of the Bank's economic development mission.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Financial Sector Technical
            Assistance Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Technical
            Assistance Loan Project will support the development of
            institutional capacity, to assist in the implementation of
            Brazil's program of financial sector reforms. The two
            main components will: 1) provide support in addressing
            systemic financial sector issues, by reinforcing banking
            supervision, through the Central Bank. Included is the
            support for the payments system reform, through policy
            advice on risk control management, operational upgrading,
            and development of an efficient government securities
            market. Banking supervision will be strengthened, through a
            combination of studies, information technology upgrade,
            policy formulation, and training assistance. In addition,
            improvements in the banking system safety net will be
            supported, through a revision of bank failure resolution
            rules, initiation of contingency planning, and improved
            monitoring of bank interventions; and, 2) strengthen
            regulation, and compliance, and, increase transparency and
            investor protection in the area of securities markets, by
            supporting the Brazilian Securities Commission - CVM.
            Specifically, diagnostic work will propose options on the
            role, responsibilities, and resources of the CVM. Included
            is the revision of the regulatory framework in terms of
            governance, accounting techniques expected under the revised
            Corporate and Securities Laws, improved market surveillance,
            and strengthened disclosure, and investor protection.
            Technical assistance, training, and information technology
            will support capacity building of both the Central Bank, and CVM.
